definition: To diminish or reduce the strength, power, or effectiveness of something or someone. It is commonly used to describe the action of weakening or undermining a person, an argument, a position, or an organization.

examples.german: Ich habe einige Schwächen in Mathe.
examples.english: I have some weaknesses in math.

examples.german: Die Krankheit hat seine körperlichen Schwächen verstärkt.
examples.english: The illness has intensified his physical weaknesses.

examples.german: Sie versucht, ihre Schwächen zu überwinden.
examples.english: She is trying to overcome her weaknesses.

examples.german: Die Mannschaft hat ihre Schwächen im Spiel gezeigt.
examples.english: The team showed its weaknesses in the game.

examples.german: Die Schwächen des Produkts wurden in den Kundenbewertungen erwähnt.
examples.english: The weaknesses of the product were mentioned in the customer reviews.
